alert.note: Alert for Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 18 at 8:35AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Charleston. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 834 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Pleasant, Isle Of Palms, Sullivan`s Island, Capers Inlet, Mount Pleasant Towne Centre, Boone Hall Plantation, Sullivans Island, Price Inlet, Hamlin Plantation, Wild Dunes, Dewees Island, Whitehall Terrace, Mount Pleasant Hospital, Seaside Farms, East Cooper Regional Medical Center, Capers Island, Fort Moultrie and The Old Village.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
